page.title: 05TRANSPORT
page.content: There is no regular{Public Transport other than a privately run Minibus that leaves the village at 10.00am for Pickering, where it is Market Day, and returns to the Village about 2.00pm. The school children who live more than 2 miles away are brought to the school by taxi.(i.e.Landrover) Practically all families have a car as it is essential for shopping and travelling to work. Young teenagers learn to drive as soon as possible, firstly a motor cycle at 16 and a car at 17.Some of the young men take a driving test on a tractor. Horse Riding is very popular amongst the young girls in the Dale which is not only a leisure activity but also a mode of transport.
